name: Sea Club Resort

reviews.text: I've seen the commercial where the family moves in the hotel room then looks out to the window they find a cemetery, well I wish that was the place., this was worse.. we first could not stay in the room because of the odor in room 332, the wet carpet and once open the balcony door we saw the alley and piles of old mattresses.
reviews.title: Smell bad, looks bad

likes.disliked: — everything, the smell, the view of the alley, and smelly carpet and leaky bathroom

reviews.text: We had to drive around all day and night and had to stay there for a couple of hours to recover.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.text: It was the worst stay in any hotel in my life. The water leak and dripping in the bathroom, the sound of alarms of cars early morning.
reviews.title: Find Another Place to stay
Would not stay at the Sea Club again
reviews.text: One thing hotels.com does not show is the SMELL...of sewers.

reviews.title: A Vacation never to forget!!! It couldn't be better!!!!!
reviews.text: I don't think this hotel will survive another year of operation..mark my word on it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a bad place to stay before a cruise. Yes, it is an older hotel. But for the money, the rooms are clean and the staff were helpful. This is a great location right across from the beach and plenty of shopping (forget anything before you get on your cruise ship?). You get a free continental breakfast that can be upgraded for a nominal fee, and, a free drink at the bar as well. The staff helped us get a transfer to our ship and other guests to the airport. We have stayed at another hotel in Fort Lauderdale that was an absolute horror show. We were pleasantly surprised for what we received for the price. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Deal for the Money

reviews.text: My husband and I stay at this hotel now every time we go to Ft. Lauderdale because it's a very convenient location. It's located on the A1A strip, across from the ocean. While it's an older, established hotel, it is clean and and a friendly place to stay. The desk clerks and manager are very courteous and do the best they can to accommodate needs and questions. My son comes here for his annual visit from California and we've agreed that it's the best location for our needs.We will be there again in May 2012 as part of his yearly vacation.
reviews.title: Convenient Stay

reviews.text: I made two comments about this place . . As long as you don't look at anything too closely you probably won't realize the state of disrepair and the pillows were flat and the beds were not.
reviews.title: As long as you don't look too closely . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night in preparation for a cruise, and I don't think we could have stayed any longer. It would be an excellent hotel for spring break. The big positive was the location, very close to the beach and a relatively easy walk to food since their restaurant would not push two tables together for us. The negatives were numerous. Old rooms, old beds, poor televisions, old facilities (a screw actually feel from the roof and hit me on the head)
reviews.title: worst hotel EVER!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The staff was fairly neutral, not unfriendly but not very helpful either.
reviews.title: Condition of floors & cleanliness of walls left room for much improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed with the cleanliness , excellent service, beautiful view of the ocean, with freighters constantly parading at close range, and location and accessibility of the hotel. The bed was most comfortable and the Tv was 1st class. It was easy to get to all parts of Ft. Lauderdale, as well as the the main highways for North and South Florida. The free and well lit parking was also a plus. with security being no problem. Our luggage was beautifully handled with eager to please attendants, after we pulled up on the semicircular driveway, just in front of the hotel. The "Deck Restaurant" for us provided prompt breakfasts with unobstructed views of the interesting ocean, as well as the walkers and joggers, having their own designated lane on A1A. The guests were friendly and were from everywhere, it seemed. The prices were certainly reasonable, and we would certainly return again.
reviews.title: Our Stay at the Sea Club Resort far exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this through using points on my Visa card. I was very apprehensive, after reading a number of reviews and seeing some of the pics. Upon walking into the lobby, the customer in front of me was upset with the front desk that someone was already inhabiting the room she'd been given. Then, we receive our own room key and went up to our assigned room; it had two beds instead of one king (as specified in our reservation), and the room smelled REALLY bad of mildew. I'm pretty tolerant with stuff like that, but the odor was overpowering. BUT - here's the good part of the review! We endured that first night (was too tired from travel to address it with the front desk). The next morning, I explained the situation to the counter person (I forget her name), she was SUPER accommodating. She let me check another room to make sure it was to my liking and satisfaction - it was. We had a problem with the lock, and she sent someone right up to fix it. The new room had a nicer view, too (and very comfortable bed). The hotel IS in need of some TLC and general renovation, but overall, it's pretty decent. We didn't use the little restaurant and bar connected to it, but clearly that place (The Deck) is very popular, as it was hopping and busy the whole time. I didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice and inviting. I had a drink and enjoyed the atmosphere out there one evening as the sun set. Also, the Sea Club is very near all of the great Ft. Lauderdale stuff you'd want to experience: beach, Galleria, Wilton Manors and Coral Ridge areas, etc. Lots of dining and nighlife around there as well. We walked to Bubba Gumps Shrimp for dinner the first night. If you're looking for real high class, luxury accommodations... then don't stay here. But for $100 a night, beachfront lodgings in a MORE than decent little place, you should check it out! I was happy, and would go back.
reviews.title: Good value, great location, ocean close.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely go back in a few months. Had suite on 5th floor; new kitchen, new bath and breathtaking view of sunset and ocean. FREE Parking. Manager extremely conscientious and eager to please; staff were very responsive. My A/C was working fine. Great location right on the beach and they offer beach chairs and great pool. Had private balcony with my suite! Hated to leave! :-( The restaurant downstairs was very convenient, friendly, good food, great drinks!
reviews.title: GREAT VIEW FROM BALCONY.

reviews.text: I get so annoyed with the travellers that expect the W Hotel status when they are staying at a motel. I went down to Ft. Lauderdale twice in 2011 April & July and both times stayed at the Sea Club. Perfect location across from the beach with free chairs, towels and WIFI everyday all day. I needed some me time and ended snaging cheap airline tickets and wasn't interested in spending all my money on a hotel....HELLO, I came for the beach/pool not to be coop up in a room. Staff was awesome, my room was cleaned everyday. The first time I booked online and got the free continental breakfast and 2 drink coupons per day and I thought that was perfect with the rate that I pd...under $300 for 4nights. Within walking distance to the resturants and shopping I couldn't ask for anything better.
reviews.title: Awesome stay, so good I went back twice in one year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel hasnt been cleaned ,or updated since the sixties.The toilets were cracked and rusty. The air conditioner was missing dials.It was so noisy at night,I wanted to leave.I heard many complaints. If it wasnt paid for, I would have left.They need to remove this hotel from all travel websites.
reviews.title: Run,don't walk !

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights before a cruise. We did not have a car. This was an excellent location, especially when you need to walk everywhere. Sure the hotel could use some updating, but we were not in our room much. The room was clean, the shower had excellent water pressure and plenty of hot water. The room was very spacious. The deck had good drinks and a great view! The staff was nice and helpful, they told us about the water taxi's and how to get there. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Convenient location and excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older hotel in a great beachfront location for travellers on a budget. As long as you understand going in that this is basic accomodation you wont be disappointed. The smalliish room was ready and clean and the beds were new and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast at The Deck was good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great Location on a Budget

reviews.text: That said - even for a 2 star facility they could do a better job on maintenance.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Location, Location, Location! The location was great. The entire staff (front desk employees, the cleaning people and the manager) were all extremely friendly and helpful and the price was great. Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Shabby Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel because we we going for a cruise to Bahamas leaving from Ft Lauderdale.
reviews.title: Good price beachfront hotel, not so good quality...

reviews.text: The hotel is right in front of the beach. The service was average, depending who was in the front desk.
reviews.title: OKAY is the Word for this hotel

likes.liked: — Across the street from the beach.

reviews.text: There was nothing special about the hotel.
reviews.title: nasty
Saved money and made my wife happy too
reviews.text: The room was okay...not very good, but it was fine. It was spacious.

reviews.title: No! No! No! Do not consider staying here!!! Pease!!!
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the value. We got a very good deal for it, $50 for the night before the cruise and $100 when we got back. Theses prices are hard to find in Ft Lauderdale.

my wife and 2 children were taking a cruise out of miami,fl to jamaica. we wanted to arrive a day early then go on down to the terminal refreshed and rested.we had made plans originally to stay in miami at a closer place to the port but after looking at sea clubs web site decided the rooms were nice and cheaper so we decided to stay there. WRONG!!!!!. we had a big problem with the safe charge that was worn out and weren't goin to use anyway. the room was a 30.00 room at best. sliding door to balcony was worn out. air conditioner wouldnt work very well. the whole place was just old and tired as stated in the other reviews. I wish that we had only looked at your reviews before changing our original plans. we would definetly not stay here again if the price dropped from 68.00 to 28.00 a night (plus of course 2.00 safe fee that columbus used i think). the on-site restaraunt was ok. oh yeah we were charged a 50.00 room deposit because we had kids maybe?? but some in our group weren't charged this deposit. our group rented 10 rooms at this place based on our recommendation and all were disappointed.
reviews.title: what a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the Sea Club Resort during the Air & Sea Show and we had a wonderful time! we stayed in room 416 with a balcony overlooking the Ocean, the room was very clean, with a daily service that we didn't expect from a budget hotel, they changed our linens every day, the maid was very helpful, asking us for our needs! the entire staff was very friendly, starting from the Front Desk and ending at their restaurant that has the most beutiful view just on top of the Ocean. Food is very good and very reasonable, so you don't needto walk around and look for any other restaurants, I like their German food, it is unique for that area! The location of the hotel couldn't be any better! the whole Air show was just infront of the hotel and it payed any dollar that we paid for the location of the hotel! We are highly recomending this establishment, and hope to enjoy it again next year at the next Air & Sea Show in Fort Laudrdale.
reviews.title: Best Return On Our Money!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Right on the Beach,Clean,friendly staff,price is resonable
likes.disliked: — In the end going back to reality, going home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to the staff, please keep dooing the good job!
reviews.title: Old and tired resort

likes.liked: — The location of the motel and the price
likes.disliked: — Old and outdated, lack of ammenities like an ice machine and pop machine

reviews.title: Do not stay here
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Sea Club resort. I had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: read the reviews and had some doubts, but decided to take a chance and made the reservation. The Sea Club is an old and
reviews.title: I didn't pay for The Ritz, so I got what I expected

reviews.text: We stayed at Sea Club pre and post cruise. Other than the fact that it was absolutely filthy, it was not acceptable as any category star hotel. A hotel does not have to be fancy but it must be clean. The bathrooms were dirty. Our blankets were torn and cigarette burned although there was supposed to be no smoking in the rooms. The mess behind the desk was unacceptable as we had to leave our luggage there until the room was ready. Our room was not cleaned until 5 pm and when it was one of the beds was made and the other wasn't. The coffee from the morning was still there and the carpets in our room or anywhere else was never vacuumed during our stay fro 3 days. Someone should definitely inspect this place and they will find that it is not sanitary. They had the audacity to ask for a $50 deposit in case the room was wrecked. Are you kidding? Don't stay there! it is sadly the worst place I have ever been in and I wouldn't let my pets stay there.
reviews.title: Couldn't be worse

reviews.text: This "resort" would be better described as a ghetto motel. This wouldn't have been too bad as we were there to see the city and didn't spend much time in the room itself. As soon as the staff noticed this, though, they seemed to watch our every move and during our last night while the 3 of us in our party were having a night on the town about 800 USD was taken from our safe. These are the types of safes with digital code entry that you make up yourself upon arrival and are reset after you leave, so obviously the hotel has an override code to make this possible. They didn't take everything, just enough so that the following morning while we were in a rush to check out they thought we wouldn't notice. Luckily...if you can even put it that way, we checked that night upon return. It was still our loss in the end though. Despite waiting for the FPD all night and filing an official report this is considered a "civil" issue so the hotel was not legally required to interegate the safes, which they refused to do, stating the new system did not yet log the activity on the safes. In order to persue charges we would have to fly back to Florida to do so, and obviously nobody would that unless it was 1000s stolen, so basically we are at a dead end and our vacation was tainted. Don't let yourself be a victim of this...do your research before staying in this type of establishment. Spend the bit of extra money to stay in a nice hotel with a good reputation and be very careful when using safes in any place you stay because they are never liable for your losses...
reviews.title: Don't use the safe!!!

reviews.text: this is a great budget hotel. you cant beat the location. its on A1A ACROSS FROM THE BEACH.the staff is helpful towels and achair for the beach.close to everything and in a safe neighborhood. the hotel is older but my room was clean everything worked including ice cold a/c. remember this is a budget hotel not a resort
reviews.title: GREAT BUDGET HOTEL

reviews.text: After seeing pictures & reading reviews of the Sea Club Resort, I booked a room after a cruise. What a mistake! On arrival, the lobby was full of people making angry remarks at the staff due to overbooking rooms & that rooms were not ready (this was 5pm and rms were to be ready at 3pm), rooms that on inspection by guests were dirty. Behind the reservation desk, suitcases were piled high as no one could get in rooms-with no security or card system. You took your chances if you left your luggage.There was a dirty hand written sign on the main (and only) elevator that it was broken (and had been for several days). The back emergeny door was propped open; anyone could get in from the outside. The lobby, restaurant and pool area was filthy, carpeting was ripped and the entire building complex, indoors/outdoors, hadn't been painted, repaired or cleaned for yrs. Staff was frazzled and I felt sorry for them---no smiles but there was a dirty aged sign on the wall saying the place was noted for exceptional service. Yes, the price was right and there was a ocean beach across the road. But as everyone said in the lobby, NEVER AGAIN! It should be demolished and the owner fined for misleading advertising and running a hotel in a good location into the ground.
reviews.title: Misleading photos & reviews of a dirty, rundown hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at this hotel for 3 or 4 days at a time for the last 8 years before going on a cruise. It has old-fashioned charm and a great location on Ft Lauderdale Beach Blvd right across from the ocean beach. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and always makes us feel welcome. In particular, Sandra at the front desk and Ronen, the manager, always greet us like old friends and go out of their way to make sure that we are happy with our room and have everything that we want. The rooms are always comfortable and clean and over the years, they have done quite a lot of remodeling to update the hotel. They have complimentary beach towels and lounge chairs available at the front desk that you can take to the beach. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel which is a nice bonus considering the affordable rates. There are many restaurants, bars and coffee shops within walking distance of the hotel although it has its own bar/restaurant, The Deck, which offers good food and drinks and a great view of the ocean. The Sea Club Resort is our home away from home.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I live in the UK, I have stayed at more than 270 hotels in N America in the last fifteen years. This was possibly the worst of all of them. When I drove up, I could see by the peeling paint and the dirty windows that it was going to be awful, but having pre-paid Expedia I could not cancel.
reviews.title: Just Awful
not as bad as they say
reviews.text: Although it's across a 4-lane highway from the sea, no rooms overlook the sea. It's a mix of internal and external corridors and once, probably centuries ago, was a Ramada. I wished I had brought some rubber gloves with me to avoid touching the rusting, mangled railings on our external corridor, the greasy door handles, the ancient bathroom fittings. There were bloodstains on the pillow case - not something that you want to live with. Although our room had recently been painted, they had not removed the wall lamps, switches, furniture etc before they painted, so there was paint over them all. Our room looked at the side wall of the hotel next door.
Front staff were not friendly. There was a bar and a restaurant but I didn't risk either. Perhaps this is valuable real estate and they are waiting to sell. Demolition would be a good idea.
reviews.title: Great beach vacation on a budget

reviews.text: OK so after reading all the reviews on this little hotel, we were a bit worried. We went with the attitude "if we expect the worst , it can't be any worse". With that said, we entered the Sea Club at approx. 2:00 pm on a Sat. afternoon. Our check in went quick and smooth. The lobby area wasn't huge but it looked nice. We grabbed our luggage and headed upstairs to our rooms. Most of us chose to use the stairs , as the elevator is very small. But not as scary as others made it seem.
reviews.title: Don't Waste The Time.. At All!!!!

reviews.text: We entered our room. Nothing fancy but it was clean. I did notice a slight musty odor. Nothing to get too concerned about. Like i said it was slight. Bathroom was small. But who needs a large bathroom. There are shelves to set your things on.
reviews.title: Never Again and thank god it was only for one night!

likes.disliked: — Opening the door to our room for the first time

description: Welcome to the SEA CLUB RESORT, a true Fort Lauderdale Beach Hotel, directly across from the Atlantic Ocean. Relaxed and affordable, where our guests enjoy the oceanfront Deck Restaurant & Bar or a light meal and a drink poolside, as the ocean does its magic.
